tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE food_activities (
  activity_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  activity_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  activity_type VARCHAR(50),
  activity_location TEXT,
  activity_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE CookingClasses (
    class_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    class_name VARCHAR(255),
    date_scheduled DATE,
    instructor_name VARCHAR(255),
    capacity INT
);

CREATE TABLE Tastings (
    tasting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    tasting_name VARCHAR(255),
    tasting_date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    participant_limit INT
);

CREATE TABLE CookingClasses (
    class_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    class_name VARCHAR(50),
    class_description TEXT,
    instructor_name VARCHAR(50),
    class_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE CookingClasses (
    class_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    class_name VARCHAR(50),
    chef_name VARCHAR(50),
    class_date DATE,
    max_capacity INT
);

CREATE TABLE Tastings (
    tasting_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    tasting_name VARCHAR(50),
    tasting_location VARCHAR(100),
    tasting_date DATE,
    organizer_name VARCHAR(50),
    tasting_type VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Tourists (
    tourist_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    tourist_name VARCHAR(50),
    nationality VARCHAR(50),
    age INT,
    email VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE Registration (
    registration_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    class_id INT,
    tourist_id INT,
    registration_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (class_id) REFERENCES CookingClasses(class_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (tourist_id) REFERENCES Tourists(tourist_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Participants (
   participant_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   participant_name VARCHAR(50),
   participant_email VARCHAR(50),
   class_id INT,
   FOREIGN KEY (class_id) REFERENCES CookingClasses(class_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Reviews (
   review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
   reviewer_name VARCHAR(50),
   rating INT,
   review_text TEXT,
   tasting_id INT,
   FOREIGN KEY (tasting_id) REFERENCES Tastings(tasting_id)
);
